p: Fourteen dogs met the inclusion criteria, of which 12 (85%) survived. CT scans revealed cranial vault fractures, parenchymal abnormalities, or both in 10/14 dogs (71%). ROC analysis for prediction of survival by the KCTS yielded an area under the curve of 0.896 (95% confidence interval, 0.726‚Äê1). A KCTS score of <3 points was associated with survival with 83% sensitivity and 100% specificity.
